derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting the renunciation of an allegiance or friendship): from Old French, from defier 'defy'

entry.def: Defiance is behaviour or an attitude which shows that you are not willing to obey someone.

entry.tran: 违抗（某人）；无视，不顾(规定、法律等)
entry.def: If you do something in defiance of a person, rule, or law, you do it even though you know that you are not allowed to do it.

example.ex: Thousands of people have taken to the streets in defiance of the curfew.
example.tran: 成千上万的人不顾宵禁涌上街头。
